data.title: Food was great; Service was lacking
data.text: We walked in to this restaurant and it was 2/3 full (not a large restaurant).  We were told to take a table.  We asked for a glass of water.  It was probably 10 minutes before we got some water.  We asked that our order be taken and were told our waitress would be with us shortly.  Two bowls of chips later the waitress came for our order.  It was a simple order, soup and quesadilla.  However it took another 10-15 minutes to receive the food.  The shrimp quesadilla, albondigas soup, and chicken tortilla soup were delicious.  What was lacking here was service.  Its not like the restaurant was full with people lined up at the door.

data.title: Inexpensive Mexican Food
data.text: Have only been here once so my review is limited. Standard Mexican food. Hard taco was good, rice and beans average. Enchillada sauce was thin and my least favorite thing. It's conveniently located for me and inexpensive. It's OK but  nothing special.

data.title: Mexican restaurant: Tio Chavas
data.text: My favorite place to eat! I love their diverse menu, the prices are reasonable and hiding in the kitchen is a great chef! Their soups have fresh ingredients is,Chicken and Vegetables and Pozole.I usually get the Pollo Cacero it's delicious! Meanwhile, my husband prefers the combination plate, served with rice and beans.You can't go wrong.

data.title: Great, family run Mexican food Restaurant!
data.text:
We have a lot of family in the area and my Wife is Hispanic, so she knows her Mexican food.  When we visit California, we love to eat here.  The family who owns the place are so friendly and welcoming.  The Chile Relleno burritos are fantastic and the Taco Tuesday spread is amazing!  My family also raves about the shredded beef crispy tacos.

Great food and very reasonable prices.  Located in the El Pollo Loco strip mall.

data.title: Inexpensive Mexican food in the middle of town.
data.text: They offer the usual Mexican food with no frills. Rice and beans and tacos. Nothing special. It is located in a small shopping strip and is hard to find parking during lunch hour. No bar service.

data.title: Family dinner
data.text: We met family here for dinner while we were visiting from North Dakota. The food is authentic Mexican and delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful. The sour cream enchiladas were wonderful. We totally enjoyed our visit.

data.title: Not the best but not the worst
data.text: Service was a little slow, especially since there weren't that many people in there. I was really looking forward to the albondigas soup but it was so bland and greasy. The enchilada and chile relleno were okay. In a pinch, I'd go back but I wouldn't go out of my way to get there.

data.title: Not good service
data.text: There's not that many people in here and we keep having to ask for service! Very disappointing.  The good is good it just lacks in service!

data.title: The Best
data.text: We have been customers for years and this family owned business is THE best Mexican food. They have catered at least 5 of our large Christmas parties. The food is consistently delicious w/generous servings. Well worth it.

data.title: Tio Chavas is great
data.text: Five stars on Trip Advisor, not Michellin.  The food here is fantastic.  I have had almost every item on their menu.  I have never had a bad meal there.  They also have a full bar and are pretty good at making mixed drinks.  Good beer selection and a very generous children's menu.  This is a great little restaurant.  Well worth the time to find them, sit down and enjoy a meal.

data.title: Great local restaurant with lunch specials
data.text: There are a lot of restaurants that locals in Yorba Linda just rave about and I think this is one that does not get enough attention.  Its a small family owned Mexican restaurant with some decent regular fare.  They also have some great lunch specials.

data.title: Authentic!!!!
data.text: Wow!  Such a rare find in Yorba Linda!  Very authentic Mexican restaurant.....staff is amazing with wonderful hospitality.  Best Modelo Micheladas in town!!!!!!  Have eaten here three times, now.  Hubby and son love it, too.  I had shrimp fajitas last time and they were over the top yummy with tons of fixin's.  The chips and salsa are delicious - I always order extra because I hog it all.  Plenty of seating and great air conditioning.  We love this place!

data.title: Family Owned Mexican Restaurant
data.text: Food is good and very reasonably priced.  Service is great.  On Taco Tuesday you walk up to the counter where your tortillas are being freshly grilled. You have an array of meats to choose from (one soy) and then you proceed with your plate to add your items from the bar such as cheese, lettuce, onion, salsa.  One of the best around.

data.title: I love this place
data.text: Great food all day everyday. I have seriously never had a bad meal or service here. Nothing fancy, it's clean, casual, fast, and friendly atmosphere.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in Yorba Linda!
data.text: A family owned and run Mexican restaurant.  They have great chips and salsa, $4 margaritas during Happy Hour, daily specials, and the best tasting, most reasonably priced food anywhere.  Usually eat there once a week.  My sons always order the 5 soft tacos for $6 deal.  Come on Tuesday evenings for their taco bar.  And their fried ice cream is the best!  You won't be sorry you ate here!  It shares a parking lot with El Pollo Loco.

data.title: Real Mexican food
data.text: This is our third day in Southern California and we've been searching for great Mexican food. I would suggest you make this a MUST try if you are in the area. I had the shredded beef burrito (it was the size of a small football) and it was excellent. Only $7.95!!  My wife had 2 alacarte items that were just as good. Give it a try.

data.title: Great job catering
data.text: We recently used Tio Chavas for a graduation party.  The taco bar was delicious and the server that served was very nice and helpful.  I was a little bit nervous since I have never used Tio Chavas for catering, however I won't hesitate to do it again!

data.title: Best Mexican food in Yorba Linda
data.text: We go to this Restaurant about once a Week.  Sometimes after Church for Breakfast.  On Tueday they have Taco Tuesday.

data.title: Tasty Breakfast Burrito
data.text:
Stopped by for a quick breakfast burrito and it was quite good. Normally, it comes with beans but I requested that they were not included because that just didn't sound right for breakfast. The egg, potato, bacon and salsa were a nice combination for a tasty breakfast. The salsa choices seem to be mild and medium, nothing too hot. 
If you need a breakfast burrito early, this may be difficult because they don't open until 8:00am, which is somewhat late for breakfast on the way to work. They were very quick about preparation as it only took 3-5 minutes. It was reasonably priced around $6.00 which seems to be the going price for a breakfast burrito in Yorba Linda.

data.title: Hands down the BEST meal on my trip!!!!
data.text: So we had some time to eat in between hockey games and our phone pointed us to this restaurant. When we pulled up we were not quite sure what we had go ourselves into. But we were greeted by a nice waitress and we sat down wondering what was going to come? What came was some of the best food that I have ever had, the best mexican food that I have ever had period. The waitress was this nice old lady. She never let us run out of chips, salsa, or drinks. This will be a place that I hit every time I head down to Disneyland from Salt Lake.
